questions.text: A 40-year-old male presented with features of paresthesias & difficulty walking. On examination, you are noticing the gait as shown below. Which of the following conversion reactions will be affected in this patient?

options.label: D
options.text: Methyl malonyl co-A to Succinyl Co-A

questions.correct_answer: D. Methyl malonyl co-A to Succinyl Co-A

questions.text: A 25-year-old man is brought to the emergency department after a fight at a bar. He has difficulty breathing and pain in the chest. The pain increases on deep inspiration. On examination, breath sounds are decreased, and percussion is hyperresonant on the left side. Chest x-ray reveals tracheal deviation towards the right. Which of the following statements best describes the changes in lung and thoracic volume in this patient compared to normal?

options.label: A
options.text: Lung Volume Thoracic Volume Decreased Increased

options.label: B
options.text: Lung Volume Thoracic Volume Decreased Decreased

options.label: C
options.text: Lung Volume Thoracic Volume Increased Decreased

options.label: D
options.text: Lung Volume Thoracic Volume Decreased No change

questions.correct_answer: A. Lung Volume Thoracic Volume Decreased Increased

Decreased Increased

Decreased Decreased

Presenting symptoms

 
  • Sudden chest pain
  • Rapid shallow breathing
  • Dyspnea

Examination findings
  • Decreased breath sounds
  • Hyperresonant percussion note
  • Tachycardia
  • Tachypnea

A cherry red macula was also noticed in both eyes during the fundus examination. Suspecting sphingolipidosis, the physician tested for globosides and gangliosides levels and found that both were increased . Based on this finding, what is the most accurate diagnosis for this patient?
questions.explanation:
Disease

 

 Deficient enzyme

 

 Lipid accumulating

Tay-Sach’s disease

Sandhoff’s disease

A and B

questions.text: A 35-year-old patient presents to the clinic with persistent allergic rhinitis and asthmatic episodes with peripheral hypereosinophilia. Histological findings are shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 37-year-old woman presented with a history of left-sided chest pain of 1-week duration. She had no h/o trauma to her chest and denied mastalgia or discharge from the nipple. She had no systemic symptoms such as fever, loss of appetite, or loss of weight. ECG and ECHO turned out normal. She had no significant past medical or surgical history of note. On examination, a tender area on the left anterolateral part of her lower chest and abdomen with a vertical cord-like swelling just under the skin extending from the lower part of her left breast to the iliac fossa was noted. These findings were compatible with a clinical diagnosis of

A 25-year-old nulliparous woman at 30 weeks of gestation is admitted to the labor room with a BP of 160/110 mmHg, urine albumin 1+ by dipstick. There is no complaint of headache, blurring of vision, epigastric pain, or decreased urine output. NST is reactive. Further management includes all except:

options.label: A
options.text: Send for urgent CBC, LFT, and RFT

options.label: C
options.text: Immediate C section if cervix unfavorable

questions.correct_answer: C. Immediate C section if cervix unfavorable

questions.text: A 32-year-old lethargic male was brought to the emergency department with a history of consumption of some drug. On investigation, he had low calcium, serum creatinine -3.8 mg/dL, raised BUN. On ABG, metabolic acidosis was noted. On urine examination, calcium oxalate crystals were observed. He was treated with 4-methyl pyrazole. What could be the probable drug ingestion leading to the following condition?

A 39-year-old woman, gravida 2, para 1, at 30-weeks gestation comes to the physician for a prenatal visit. The patient's due date was determined by a 7-week ultrasound. Her prenatal course has been unremarkable. She has no complaints of contractions, loss of fluid, or bleeding from the vagina, and her baby is moving well. Examination demonstrates a fetal heart rate of 150 and a fundal height of 27 centimeters, which is the same measurement as that determined 4 weeks ago. This patient's fundal height measurement is most suggestive of which of the following?

options.label: A
options.text: Inaccurate estimated date of delivery (due date)

questions.text: A 75-year-old man is admitted to the emergency department with acute-onset suprapubic pain and inability to pass urine for 2 days. On examination, the patient is in discomfort, neurologically intact, and the abdomen is particularly tender in the suprapubic region. A digital rectal examination reveals a smooth, enlarged prostate. What is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Bladder outflow obstruction due to prostate cancer

options.label: B
options.text: Bladder outflow obstruction due to benign prostatic hypertrophy

options.label: C
options.text: Bladder outflow obstruction due to a urethral stricture

options.label: D
options.text: Bladder outflow obstruction due to a spinal cord lesion

questions.correct_answer: B. Bladder outflow obstruction due to benign prostatic hypertrophy

questions.text: In a child with Tetralogy of Fallot with fever and diarrhoea, which of the following is the surest sign of a cyanotic spell:

options.label: A
options.text: Arterial oxygen saturation of less than 75%

questions.text: A 54-year-old man comes to the physician for evaluation of exertional chest pain. He first noticed the pain a couple of months ago when he was shoveling snow off his driveway and has since experienced several episodes while doing other strenuous tasks. He describes the pain as a heavy, crushing sensation and says it is relieved with rest. The patient undergoes coronary angiography and is found to have severe stenosis of the right coronary artery and left anterior descending and circumflex arteries. He is referred to a surgeon for coronary artery bypass grafting. During the procedure, a portion of his great saphenous vein is removed and grafted to one of the diseased coronary arteries to bypass its atherosclerotic narrowing. The vein used as a graft during this patient's procedure can be accessed at which of the following sites?

options.label: A
options.text: At the midline of the popliteal fossa

options.label: B
options.text: Just inferior to the anterior superior iliac spine

options.label: C
options.text: Just inferolateral to the pubic tubercle

options.label: D
options.text: Just superior to the inguinal ligament

questions.correct_answer: C. Just inferolateral to the pubic tubercle

questions.text: A 35-year-old butcher is admitted after stabbing himself with a knife inadvertently. His airway is patent and there are no identifiable hindrances to breathing. His pulse is 110 beats/min, BP is 130/105 mmHg, and respiratory rate is 25 breaths/min. Assuming a body mass of 70 kg, what is the best-estimated volume of blood lost?

options.label: D
options.text: Impossible to say from given information

questions.text: A 36-week preterm female infant is now 4 hours old. She was born via emergency LSCS for breech position after preterm labor. Her mother was given 1.2 g IV benzylpenicillin 3 hours before delivery. She cried soon after birth and her birth weight was 2600 g. In the last hour, the baby has had four episodes where she stopped breathing for >20 seconds, her heart rate dropping to <80 beats per minute, and her oxygen saturation decreased to <70%. She requires firm stimulation by the nursing staff to resolve these episodes. Between episodes her oxygen saturation is normal. She is not currently on any medications. Which one of the following options is the most appropriate next step in the management of her apnoea?

options.label: B
options.text: Commence caffeine for apnoea of prematurity.

options.label: C
options.text: Perform a sepsis work-up and commence IV antibiotics.

options.label: D
options.text: Start mask continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP)

questions.correct_answer: C. Perform a sepsis work-up and commence IV antibiotics.

questions.text: A small disk of neoprene with metal periphery ensures a gas-tight fit between the cylinder and anesthetic machine yoke in the form of seal (shown in the figure) is called as?

A 2-year-old girl presented with a history of dyspnea and recurrent bronchitis. On auscultation, a loud systolic murmur was detected. Her clinical examination was otherwise normal. An electrocardiogram (ECG) was done in the patient which showed an incomplete bundle branch block in the precordial lead. This is most consistent with which of the following?

options.label: B
options.text: A sinus venosus Atrial septal defect with partial anomalous pulmonary venous return

options.label: C
options.text: An ostium primum Atrial septal defect

questions.correct_answer: A. A secundum Atrial septal defect

questions.text: What treatment is recommended for a 45-year-old male with schizophrenia who developed fever, diarrhea, confusion, high blood pressure, rapid pulse, muscle rigidity, hyperkalemia, and increased creatine kinase after 8 days of haloperidol treatment?

Neuromuscular monitoring with a peripheral nerve stimulator was used, and the maintenance doses were given accordingly during the intraoperative period. At the end of the surgery, when the train of four (TOF) ratio > 0.9, the patient was reversed with Inj. Neostigmine and glycopyrrolate were then extubated. questions.text: A 60-year-old woman presents with progressive loss of voice, numbness, and loss of taste on the back part of her tongue. MRI reveals a dural meningioma compressing nerves exiting the skull. Through which opening do these nerves leave the skull?
In a 10-year-old girl presenting with recurrent episodes of bulky stools, abdominal pain, early satiety, and poor growth, which investigation is most reliable for making a specific diagnosis?

His father suffered an aortic aneurysm at a young age. A mutation in which of the following genes is the most likely cause of the patient’s condition?

questions.text: A 55-year-old solicitor presents to the urology outpatients department with a 6-month history of abnormal angulated penis on erection. options.label: A
options.text: It is a connective tissue disorder of unknown origin

options.label: C
options.text: It is the result of a gene mutation on chromosome 6

options.label: D
options.text: Surgical treatment is considered only 1 year after initial presentation

questions.text: A 30-years-old third gravida, who has a 3-years-old child and had undergone an MTP 1 year ago, has presented with 30-weeks of gestation. She complains of having had vaginal bleeding 2 hours ago. She has not received any antenatal care. On examination, her pulse is 78 beats per minute and the BP is 102/58 mmHg. She has moderate pallor, her abdomen is soft, and the fetal heart rate is 130 beats per minute. The most appropriate management will be: Ultrasonographic evaluation Watch for labor Hospitalization and bed rest Speculum examination of vagina and cervix Intravenous fluid drip Select the appropriate treatment using the code given below:

A 12-month-old boy is brought to his primary care physician for evaluation of oral patches. A review of his medical record indicates a history of recurrent otitis media, pneumonia, chronic diarrhoea and failure to thrive. Family history is non-contributory. Physical examination demonstrates a malnourished child who appears small for his age. Oropharyngeal examination demonstrates scrapable white patches on the tongue but is otherwise unremarkable. Serum electrophoresis reveals low immunoglobulin levels, and a chest x-ray shows an absent thymic shadow. Deficiency of which of the following enzymes is most likely responsible for this patient's condition?

A 34-year-old morbidly obese diabetic woman underwent a gastric bypass about 12 hours ago. The operation was technically difficult but finally went well. You are called because she now has a temperature of 99.2 F, pulse of 134, and some pain in her incision and her back. She looks well; the incision is clean, and her examination is otherwise negative. A bolus of 500 ml of dextrose/lactated Ringer's did not change her vital signs, except that her pulse rose to 140 without an increase in urine output. Your next step should be:

options.label: C
options.text: Obtain white cell count, differential count, and electrolyte values

options.label: D
options.text: Call the operating room and inform them that you need to re-explore for a leak

questions.correct_answer: D. Call the operating room and inform them that you need to re-explore for a leak

A 35-year-old woman presents with episodes of obtundation, somnolence, and tachycardia. An insulinoma is suspected based on a random serum glucose test value of 38 mg/dl. Which of the following statements is/are true?

options.text: The most important diagnostic study for insulinoma is an oral glucose tolerance test.

questions.correct_answer: D. Preoperative evaluation in patients with presumed insulinoma involves confirming elevated C-peptide or proinsulin levels and screening for anti-insulin antibodies.

questions.text: A 4-year-old boy is brought to the physician for evaluation of fever and respiratory distress for 2 days. His temperature is 100.7 F (38.20C), pulse is 144/min, respiratory rate is 45/min, and blood pressure is 95/60 mm Hg. He is tachycardic with a III/VI holosystolic murmur best heard at the cardiac apex. Peripheral pulses are present and capillary refill is three seconds. A 68 years old female patient is brought to the emergency department had a heart attack 4 hrs ago, her blood pressure has decreased continuously, and now the patient manifests with cardiogenic shock. Which of the following would be the most beneficial therapy?

options.text: Placing tourniquets on all four limbs

questions.text: A 6-year-old boy is brought to the physician because his mother is concerned about a birthmark on his face that she would like removed for cosmetic reasons. questions.text: A woman has her shortest cycle of 26 days and the longest cycle of 31 days. Calculate her unsafe period using the Rhythm method.
questions.explanation:
Phase Description Duration
Menstrual Phase (Day 1-5) The shedding of the uterine lining, resulting in menstrual bleeding. Hormone levels are at their lowest. Approximately 5 days.
Follicular Phase (Day 1-13) The pituitary gland releases follicle-stimulating hormone (FSH), stimulating the growth of ovarian follicles. One follicle matures and releases an egg. Approximately 13 days.
Ovulation (Around Day 14) A surge in luteinizing hormone (LH) triggers the mature follicle to release an egg from the ovary. Usually occurs on or around Day 14.
Luteal Phase (Day 15-28) The empty follicle transforms into the corpus luteum, which produces progesterone and prepares the uterine lining for possible implantation. Approximately 14 days.
Pre-Menstrual Phase (Day 25-28) If pregnancy doesn't occur, the corpus luteum degenerates, leading to a drop in progesterone and estrogen levels. This triggers premenstrual symptoms. Approximately 3-4 days.

questions.text: A diabetic patient presents with bloody nasal discharge, orbital swelling, and pain. Culture of periorbital pus showing branching septate hyphae in LPCB mount. Which of the following is the most probable organism involved –
questions.explanation:
Option 1, 2, 3, 4

1. Hint is branching septate hyphae.

2. Aspergillus species are molds.

- They have septate hyphae that form V-shaped dichotomous branches. The Aspergillus species are identified by

  • (a) Their morphological features,
  • (b) The pattern of conidiophore development, and
  • (c) The color of the conidia.

- The presence of septate hyphae that branch at 45° angles is the typical feature of Aspergillus species hyphae. The hyphae in tissues are best demonstrated with silver stains. The walls of the hyphae are more or less parallel, unlike those of Mucor and Rhizopus, which are more or less irregular.

3. Mucor and Rhizopus have broad aseptate hyaline hyphae with wide angle branching.

4. Candida (GPOBYC) is a yeast like fungi.

questions.explanation:
Condition Features
Left atrial Myxoma More common in a young female with symptoms of myxoma platypnea and low cardiac output since the tumor limits the blood flow into the left ventricle.
Mitral regurgitation Ruled out as no murmur was auscultated in the patient
Cor pulmonale Ruled out as primary lung disease or findings of RVF are absent
LVH

Points in favor of diagnosis:

  1. Hypertension can lead to LVH causing double apical impulse.
  2. HTN can lead to diastolic dysfunction and impacts the atria leading to atrial fibrillation and irregular pulse
  3. Basal crepitations can be explained by atrial fibrillation.
  4. BP changes in standing and supine position are normal (less than equal to 10mm Hg)

questions.text: A medical officer is examining the genitalia of a 23-year-old college student who has filed a complaint against a fellow student. She alleges that she was invited by him on the pretext of meeting his family but was raped at the hotel they were staying in.Which area will be described by the doctor in her report, when she examines the triangular space bounded by the clitoris above, hymen below, and the labia minora laterally ?
questions.explanation:
Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Learning Objective
  • ➤ Anatomy of Female Genitals:
  • ➤ Anatomy of Female Genitals:
  • ➤ The labia majora are the two elongated folds of skin projecting downwards and backward from the mons veneris. The labia minora (4 cm long) are two thin folds of skin just within the labia majora. The lower portions of labia minora fuse in the midline and form a fold called fourchette. The depression between the fourchette and the vaginal orifice is called fossa navicularis. The vestibule is the triangular surface that extends from the clitoris above to the anterior margin of the hymen below, and laterally to the labia minora. It is usually concealed by the labia. The vulva includes the mons veneris (pad of fat lying in front of the pubis), clitoris, labia majora and minora, Vestibule, hymen, and urethral opening. The perineum is the wedge-shaped area between the lower end of the posterior wall of the vagina and the anterior anal wall.
  • ➤ The labia majora are the two elongated folds of skin projecting downwards and backward from the mons veneris.
  • ➤ The labia minora (4 cm long) are two thin folds of skin just within the labia majora.
  • ➤ The lower portions of labia minora fuse in the midline and form a fold called fourchette.
  • ➤ The depression between the fourchette and the vaginal orifice is called fossa navicularis.
  • ➤ fossa navicularis.
  • ➤ The vestibule is the triangular surface that extends from the clitoris above to the anterior margin of the hymen below, and laterally to the labia minora.
  • ➤ It is usually concealed by the labia.
  • ➤ The vulva includes the mons veneris (pad of fat lying in front of the pubis), clitoris, labia majora and minora, Vestibule, hymen, and urethral opening.
  • ➤ The perineum is the wedge-shaped area between the lower end of the posterior wall of the vagina and the anterior anal wall.

A 20-year-old female presents to the physician with complaints of vaginal itching, discharge, and pain during intercourse. She has had 3 different sexual partners over the past 2 years. As part of the workup, the doctor did a wet mount of vaginal secretions that showed flagellated organisms with "twitching motility". Identify the organism
questions.explanation:
Microorganism Trichomonas vaginalis
Classification Protozoan parasite
Infection Trichomoniasis
Transmission Primarily through sexual contact, including vaginal, anal, or oral sex
Clinical Presentation - Vaginal itching- Frothy, malodorous vaginal discharge- Pain during urination and intercourse
Pathogenesis Parasite attaches to vaginal and urethral epithelium, causing inflammation and disrupting vaginal flora
Diagnosis - Microscopic examination: "Twitching motility" of flagellated organisms in wet mount- PCR testing
Complications - Increased risk of HIV transmission- Pregnancy complications (preterm birth, low birth weight)
Treatment Antibiotics, usually metronidazole or tinidazole
Prevention - Safe sexual practices- Treatment of infected individuals and their partners
Epidemiology One of the most common curable sexually transmitted infections (STIs), affecting both men and women
Risk Factors Multiple sexual partners, unprotected sex, history of STIs
